cyclone.name: ETA
cyclone.current_location: about 90 mi W of Camaguey, Cuba and 300 mi S of Miami, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Turning north today, then northwest tonight and west on Monday – tracking across the Florida Straits, near/over the Florida Keys, and then into the southeast Gulf of Mexico with slow west-northwest motion through mid-week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Upper Florida Keys (near the Keys/Florida Straits)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Florida coast from north of Englewood to Anna Maria Island
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida coast from Brevard/Volusia County line southward to Englewood including Florida Bay and Keys; Cuba central provinces; Northwestern Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South-central Cuba, Florida Keys, southern and central Florida peninsula, portions of the west-central Florida coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible mid-week with peak 34-kt probability of 50% at the port area.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge inundation expected along the Manatee County coast based on current guidance.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring 4–8 inches with locally higher totals; NHC calls for 6–12 inches across portions of central Florida, so flash-flood risk exists at the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in rainbands and rough seas/large swells impacting port approaches.
